    • Method Detail

      • getMinimumStat

        public abstract DailyData getMinimumStat(java.lang.String variableId)
        Return the minimum of the measurement defined by the variableId parameter. If there is more than one sample that is the minimum, then return the one with the earliest date. If there are no samples, then null CAN BE returned.
        Parameters:
        variableId - String describing the measurement to compute the minimum over
        Returns:
        The DailyData object that contains the minimum value of the measurement.

      • getMinimumStat

        public abstract DailyData getMinimumStat(java.lang.String variableId,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> constraints,
                       int constraintIndex)
        Return the minimum of the measurement defined by the variableId parameter. If there is more than one sample that is the minimum, then return the one with the earliest date. If there are no valid samples, then null CAN BE returned.
        Parameters:
        variableId - String describing the measurement to compute the minimum over
        constraints - Set of constraints for this query (0=years; 1=months; 2=days)
        constraintIndex - The current constraint level
        Returns:
        The DailyData object that contains the minimum value of the measurement.

      • getMaximumStat

        public abstract DailyData getMaximumStat(java.lang.String variableId)
        Return the maximum of the measurement defined by the variableId parameter. If there is more than one sample that is the maximum, then return the one with the earliest date. If there are no samples, then null CAN BE returned.
        Parameters:
        variableId - String describing the measurement to compute the maximum over
        Returns:
        The DailyData object that contains the maximum value of the measurement.

      • getMaximumStat

        public abstract DailyData getMaximumStat(java.lang.String variableId,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> constraints,
                       int constraintIndex)
        Return the maximum of the measurement defined by the variableId parameter. If there is more than one sample that is the minimum, then return the one with the earliest date. If there are no valid samples, then null CAN BE returned.
        Parameters:
        variableId - String describing the measurement to compute the minimum over
        constraints - Set of constraints for this query (0=years; 1=months; 2=days)
        constraintIndex - The current constraint level
        Returns:
        The DailyData object that contains the minimum value of the measurement.

      • getAverageStat

        public abstract Observation getAverageStat(java.lang.String variableId)
        Return the average of the measurement defined by the variableId parameter. If there are no valid samples, then returns an invalid Observation
        Parameters:
        variableId - String describing the measurement to compute the average over
        Returns:
        The average of the valid measurements.

      • getAverageStat

        public abstract Observation getAverageStat(java.lang.String variableId,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> constraints,
                         int constraintIndex)
        Return the average of the measurement defined by the variableId parameter. If there are no valid samples, then returns an invalid Observation
        Parameters:
        variableId - String describing the measurement to compute the average over
        constraints - Set of constraints for this query (0=years; 1=months; 2=days)
        constraintIndex - The current constraint level
        Returns:
        The average of the valid measurements.
